timeline.message: Add integration test and fix broekn parts

timeline.bodyText: Let's have a variable to track TASK_CURRENT_STATE_PATH_DISABLED. We dont have to do the parse every time. Also, let's give a default value as true since participant will be the last component to deploy.
timeline.author: junkaixue

replies.bodyText:
Default value should be false because it's "disabled" right? If participants get the new version of Helix, we should assume that they want to use the new path, so "disabled" should default to false.
For variable tracking, there is a problem: if the boolean value is recorded at a central place, users cannot update this system property during run time, right?  If there is a variable that's tracking it, then it's as if it's cached.
replies.author: NealSun96

replies.bodyText:
Ah... Yeah, the "disable" should be false.
But for dynamic update, let's not overkill the design:

For Helix, we use ZK centralized config for dynamic update purpose. If we decide to use system property, it means it is not dynamic changeable.
The system property mostly comes from Java property, which require restart the application. So we cannot support dynamic update as well.

Make it a variable can also simplify the code. I would suggest create a variable to hold that when we create the object.
replies.author: junkaixue

replies.bodyText: Concluded to use one local variable when necessary.
replies.author: NealSun96

timeline.bodyText: Let's have the path build when TaskRunner instantiated.
timeline.author: junkaixue

replies.bodyText: For this I believe there's a similar problem: if users change this flag on the fly, the path has to be recreated. If we create the path when TaskRunner is instantiated, there's no way to recreate the path.
replies.author: NealSun96

replies.bodyText: Same reason as the previous, dynamic update is overkill.
replies.author: junkaixue

replies.bodyText: Concluded to use one local variable when necessary.
replies.author: NealSun96

timeline.bodyText: With this config set up as "disabled", the default behavior would be to turn on task current state. Is this the expected behavior when customers roll out?
timeline.author: zhangmeng916

replies.bodyText: Yes. When customers roll out a new versions for participants, they should expect the behavior to change accordingly. This system property is for an emergency controller rollback, during which users can disable this new behavior on participants.
replies.author: NealSun96
